contents:
620 BREAKING: Ukrainian parliament passed a bill that prohibits journalists from investigating corruption. 

- Any media coverage of corruption in the country is prohibited. 

- People involved in corruption investigations have right to request the removal of materials containing criticism or exposure. posted 5 days ago by Royall 29 comments award share download report block

Harold & Kumar's White Christmas comes to mind. They support Ukraine. permalink award report block reply TheSwampThang 2 points 5 days ago Just remember Zelensky can have his coke money but air traffic controllers and people too disabled to work have to just suck it up. permalink award report block reply Urinetensions 2 points 5 days ago Gonzalo Lira might prefer arrest to murder... permalink award report block reply shadowbanana 2 points 5 days ago CRP was an idiot that got what he deserved. You guys obviously don't know the guys history and it shows. permalink parent award report block reply Im_Not_Rattled 2 points 5 days ago Nothing screams total corruption like outlawing investigating for corruption. permalink award report block reply Oldman1234 1 points 5 days ago No wonder Democrats admire Zelensky so much.  He's called off elections so his party can stay in power indefinitely, jailed his political opponents, arrested anyone who dares speak out against him, censored free speech, controls all news media and newspapers, regulates the internet, and he's now made it illegal to investigate corruption!  A Democrat Party wet dream! permalink award report block reply josiborg 1 points 5 days ago It's like they get their legal consulting from Obama and Hunter permalink award report block reply Idontevenknow 1 points 5 days ago obvious squeaky clean is obvious permalink award report block reply mass55th 1 points 5 days ago In July of this year, Zelensky signed a Bill that effectively stripped Ukraine’s key anti-corruption bodies, the National Anti-Corruption Bureau (NABU) and the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office (SAPO) of independence. Thousands of Ukrainians poured onto the streets to protest this move. The protests lasted several days. Ukraine's Parliament was forced to pass a new Bill that restored the independence of those two agencies, however, the Bill also required polygraphs for officers. Now this. It's obvious Zelensky and the Ukraine Parliament are colluding to hide the corruption that is taking place in the government. Every 90 days, the Ukraine Parliament extends martial law in the country, and Zelensky signs that extension. He's signed 17 martial law extensions so far. The longer the Parliament and Zelensky can keep this charade going, the people of Ukraine can't vote get rid of the shit their government is doing. Recently, I read an article that they have been arresting people who enter closed Orthodox Churches to pray. permalink award report block reply Liberats 1 points 5 days ago This is going to put Ukraine at number 1 in the globalists NWO of countries following their rules. permalink award report block reply TheTelltaleFly 1 points 5 days ago United States Congress learning to use Copy-Paste as soon as they get back to work. permalink award report block reply Riehlpissed 1 points 5 days ago What a commie thing to do. permalink award report block reply Wizard_Glick 1 points 5 days ago Coming to a state near you! permalink award report block reply Formerlurker92 1 points 5 days ago As part of the peace treaty we should mandate the execution of all government officials permalink award report block reply

mass55th 1 points 5 days ago In July of this year, Zelensky signed a Bill that effectively stripped Ukraine’s key anti-corruption bodies, the National Anti-Corruption Bureau (NABU) and the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office (SAPO) of independence. Ukraine's Parliament was forced to pass a new Bill that restored the independence of those two agencies, however, the Bill also required polygraphs for officers. Now this. It's obvious Zelensky and the Ukraine Parliament are colluding to hide the corruption that is taking place in the government. Every 90 days, the Ukraine Parliament extends martial law in the country, and Zelensky signs that extension. He's signed 17 martial law extensions so far. The longer the Parliament and Zelensky can keep this charade going, the people of Ukraine can't vote get rid of the shit their government is doing.
